Create shift(s) for val using baselines generated by sus.

Shifts occur when 6 or more consecutive useful observations (non-NA and different from the current baseline) land all above/below the baseline.

multi_shift(val, base, base_ext, trigger = 6)

Arguments

val

multi_shift() iterates along the elements of val to create shifts.
base

baseline generated by sus.
base_ext

extended baseline generated by sus.
trigger

Number of data points required to create a shift.

Value

A vector with all shifts observed in val. If no shifts observed, a vector full of NAs.

See also

basic_shift

Examples

runchart:::multi_shift(val = c(rep(0,8), rep(1,8)),
base = c(rep(0,8), rep(NA,8)), base_ext = rep(0, 16))
#>  [1] NA NA NA NA NA NA NA NA  1  1  1  1  1  1  1  1

Contents
